page.title: 20ST. MARY'S CHURCH
page.content: The church chancel was built in the thirteenth century.The church is made of stone with wood to hold the slates up.The spire has a clock face on it and a weather vane on the top.There are gargoyles on the church walls,they collect the water from the roof.In the belfry there are eight bells which are often rung.The church has a gate but it is not a lych gate.There are yew trees in the churchyard.It does not have a large cross.The lectern is an eagle made of wood.The stained glass windows show the nativity and the ascension.The church has some old pews and some interesting features such as a piscina and a chest in the vestry room.
